name: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps: Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
While the pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the guanciale and cook until crisp and golden.
In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and Pecorino Romano cheese.
Drain the pasta, reserving some of the pasta water. Add the pasta to the skillet with the guanciale and toss to combine.
Remove the skillet from the heat and pour in the egg and cheese mixture, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce. If the sauce is too thick, add a little pasta water.
Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

tips.tip: For an extra creamy sauce, use one whole egg and one egg yolk.
Don't let the pan be too hot when adding the egg mixture, or you'll get scrambled eggs!

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Chunks of roasted marinated chicken in a spiced curry sauce.
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into chunks
steps: In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, garam masala, and ginger-garlic paste. Add chicken and toss to coat. Marinate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat grill or oven to high. Thread chicken onto skewers and grill for 10-15 minutes, or until cooked through.
To make the sauce, heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until soft. Stir in tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and simmer for 10 minutes. Add grilled chicken to the sauce and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

tips.tip: Toasting the spices before adding them to the marinade really brings out their flavor.

name: Classic French Onion Soup
description: A rich and savory soup made with caramelized onions, beef broth, and topped with crusty bread and melted cheese.
ingredients: 1/2 cup dry white wine or sherry
steps: In a large pot or Dutch oven, melt butter with olive oil over medium heat. Add onions, sugar, and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until deeply caramelized, about 45-60 minutes.
Deglaze the pot by pouring in the white wine and scraping up any browned bits from the bottom.
Add the beef broth, bring to a simmer, and cook for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Preheat the broiler. Ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls.
Top each bowl with a slice of toasted baguette and a generous amount of Gruyère cheese.
Place the bowls on a baking sheet and broil until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. Serve immediately.

tips.tip: Patience is key for caramelizing the onions. Don't rush this step!
A mix of Gruyère and a little bit of Parmesan on top gives it a great flavor kick.

name: Cheesy Mac and Cheese
description: A super simple and delicious homemade macaroni and cheese that kids will love.
steps: Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour, salt, and pepper until smooth; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Gradually stir in milk. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly; cook and stir 2 minutes or until thickened.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in cheeses until melted.
Add cooked macaroni; stir to coat.
Serve immediately. Enjoy!

tips.tip: A little bit of mustard powder adds a nice tang without being spicy for the kids.

name: Classic Seafood Paella
description: A classic Spanish rice dish from Valencia, brimming with fresh seafood like shrimp, mussels, and clams.
steps: In a large paella pan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Add diced tomatoes and paprika and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in the rice and cook for 1-2 minutes until coated.
Add the chicken broth and saffron threads. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, without stirring.
Arrange the seafood over the top of the rice. Cover and cook for another 5-10 minutes, or until seafood is cooked through and mussels have opened.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Authentic Tacos al Pastor
description: Thinly sliced marinated pork, pineapple, onions, and cilantro served on small corn tortillas. A true taste of Mexico City.
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless pork shoulder, thinly sliced
Corn tortillas, white onion, and cilantro for serving
steps: Blend pineapple juice, vinegar, achiote paste, chili powder, and cumin to make the marinade.
Pour the marinade over the pork and let it sit for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
Preheat a grill or large skillet. Cook the marinated pork until slightly charred and cooked through.
Grill the pineapple slices until they have nice grill marks.
Chop the cooked pork and pineapple into small pieces.
Serve the pork and pineapple on warm corn tortillas, topped with diced white onion and fresh cilantro.

name: Rich Tonkotsu Ramen
description: A rich and creamy pork bone broth ramen, topped with chashu pork, a soft-boiled egg, and green onions.
ingredients: Soy sauce, mirin, sake for chashu marinade
steps: To make the broth, boil pork bones for 10 minutes, then drain and clean them. Return to a large pot with fresh water and simmer on low for 10-12 hours.
To make chashu, roll the pork belly and tie with kitchen twine. Sear all sides, then simmer in a mixture of soy sauce, mirin, and sake for 2 hours.
Cook the ramen noodles according to package directions.
To assemble, strain the tonkotsu broth into a bowl. Add the cooked noodles.
Top with slices of chashu pork, a halved soft-boiled egg, chopped scallions, and a sheet of nori.

name: Hearty Lentil Shepherd's Pie
description: A comforting and savory vegan shepherd's pie with a rich lentil filling and a creamy mashed potato topping.
ingredients: 1 cup brown or green lentils, rinsed
4 tbsp vegan butter or olive oil
steps: Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and mash with plant-based milk, vegan butter, salt, and pepper.
In a large pot, sauté onion, carrots, and celery until softened. Add garlic and cook for another minute.
Stir in tomato paste and thyme. Add lentils and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30-40 minutes until lentils are tender.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Spread the lentil mixture into a baking dish. Top with the mashed potatoes, spreading evenly.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.

name: Moroccan Chicken Tagine
description: A fragrant and flavorful Moroccan stew with tender chicken, apricots, and almonds, simmered with aromatic spices.
steps: In a tagine or Dutch oven, brown the chicken thighs on both sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté the onion, garlic, and ginger until soft.
Stir in the turmeric, cumin, and cinnamon, and cook for one minute until fragrant.
Return the chicken to the pot. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook on low heat for 1 hour, or until the chicken is tender.
Stir in the dried apricots and cook for another 10 minutes.
Garnish with toasted almonds and fresh cilantro before serving. Serve with couscous.

name: Margherita Pizza
description: A simple yet delicious pizza topped with San Marzano tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, basil, and a drizzle of olive oil.
steps: Preheat your oven to its highest setting, around 500°F (260°C).
Stretch out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border.
Arrange the mozzarella slices on top.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
Top with fresh basil leaves, a drizzle of olive oil, and a pinch of salt before serving.

name: Mushroom Risotto
description: A creamy, comforting Italian rice dish made with Arborio rice and sautéed mushrooms.
steps: In a large pan, melt butter and sauté mushrooms until golden. Set aside.
In the same pan, sauté onion until soft. Add garlic and cook for a minute.
Add the Arborio rice and toast for 2 minutes.
Pour in the white wine and cook until it's absorbed.
Add the warm broth one ladle at a time, waiting for it to be absorbed before adding more, stirring constantly.
When the rice is creamy and al dente, stir in the cooked mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

name: Palak Paneer
description: A popular Indian vegetarian dish consisting of paneer (Indian cheese) in a smooth, creamy spinach gravy.
steps: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add the onion and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates.
Add the spinach puree, garam masala, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the paneer cubes and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Stir in the cream and turn off the heat. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Butter Chicken
description: A rich and creamy curry with tender grilled chicken, in a buttery tomato sauce.
ingredients: For marinade: Yogurt, lemon juice, spices
steps: Marinate chicken for at least 1 hour, then grill or pan-fry until cooked.
In a pan, melt butter, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, then tomato puree. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add garam masala and salt. Stir in cream and simmer.
Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with a swirl of cream.

name: Coq au Vin
description: A classic French stew of chicken braised with wine, lardons, mushrooms, and garlic.
steps: Marinate chicken in red wine overnight.
In a large pot, cook bacon until crisp. Remove and set aside.
Brown the chicken pieces in the bacon fat. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onion, carrots, and garlic until soft. Stir in tomato paste.
Return chicken to the pot. Add the marinade wine and enough broth to cover. Simmer for 1.5 hours.
Add mushrooms and cooked bacon, and cook for another 15 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Mini Pizzas
description: Fun and easy mini pizzas that kids can help make and decorate with their favorite toppings.
ingredients: Optional toppings: pepperoni, bell peppers, olives
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place pizza bases on a baking sheet.
Spread each base with pizza sauce.
Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Add any desired toppings.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and golden.

name: Homemade Chicken Nuggets
description: Crispy, juicy, and much healthier than the fast-food version. Perfect for little hands.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch pieces
steps: Set up a breading station with three shallow dishes: one for flour (mixed with salt and paprika), one for beaten eggs, and one for breadcrumbs.
Dredge each chicken piece in flour, then dip in egg, and finally coat with breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Fry the nuggets in batches for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.
Drain on a wire rack. Serve with ketchup or your favorite dipping sauce.

name: Patatas Bravas
description: A classic Spanish tapa of crispy fried potatoes served with a spicy tomato sauce.
ingredients: 2 lbs potatoes, peeled and cut into cubes
steps: Parboil the potatoes for 10 minutes. Drain well.
Heat olive oil in a skillet and fry the potatoes until golden and crisp.
For the sauce, sauté onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, paprika, and cayenne. Simmer for 15 minutes, then blend until smooth.
Serve the crispy potatoes drizzled with the bravas sauce.

name: Chicken Quesadillas
description: A quick and easy meal of tortillas filled with cheese, chicken, and served with salsa and sour cream.
ingredients: 1.5 cups shredded Monterey Jack or cheddar cheese
Salsa and sour cream for serving
steps: Lay a tortilla flat. Sprinkle half of it with cheese, top with chicken, then more cheese.
Fold the other half of the tortilla over.
Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the quesadilla for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and cheese is melted.
Repeat with the second tortilla. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa and sour cream.

name: Sushi Platter
description: A beautiful assortment of nigiri and maki rolls, showcasing fresh fish and perfectly seasoned rice.
ingredients: Soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger for serving
steps: Cook sushi rice according to package directions.
While rice is warm, gently fold in the mixture of rice vinegar, sugar, and salt.
To make nigiri, form small oblongs of rice and top with a slice of fish.
To make maki, place a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat, spread a thin layer of rice, add fillings (fish, cucumber, avocado), and roll tightly.
Slice the maki roll into pieces.
Arrange the nigiri and maki on a platter and serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and ginger.

name: Black Bean Burgers
description: Hearty and flavorful homemade black bean burgers that are simple to make and incredibly satisfying.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
steps: In a food processor, pulse bell pepper, onion, and garlic until finely chopped.
Add black beans and spices, and pulse until combined but still chunky.
Transfer to a bowl and mix in breadcrumbs. Form into 4 patties.
Cook patties in a lightly oiled skillet over medium heat for 5-7 minutes per side.
Serve on buns with your favorite toppings.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Colorful bell peppers filled with a savory mixture of rice, vegetables, and herbs, baked to perfection.
ingredients: 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella or cheddar cheese
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds.
In a skillet, sauté onion and zucchini until tender. Stir in cooked rice, diced tomatoes, and Italian seasoning.
Stuff the bell peppers with the rice mixture.
Place in a baking dish, add a little water to the bottom, and bake for 30 minutes.
Top with cheese and bake for another 10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.

name: Vegetable Couscous
description: A light and fluffy couscous served with a stew of tender vegetables and chickpeas, seasoned with Moroccan spices.
steps: In a large pot, sauté onion until soft. Add carrots, turnip, and spices, and cook for 5 minutes.
Add vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes.
Add zucchini and chickpeas, and cook for another 10 minutes until all vegetables are tender.
Prepare couscous according to package directions.
Serve the vegetable stew over a bed of fluffy couscous.

name: Classic Lasagna
description: Layers of pasta, rich meat sauce, and creamy cheese, baked to perfection.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, brown the ground beef. Drain fat and stir in marinara sauce.
In a baking dish, spread a layer of meat sauce. Top with a layer of noodles, then a layer of ricotta cheese, and a layer of mozzarella.
Repeat the layers, ending with meat sauce and mozzarella on top.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 45-60 minutes, until bubbly and golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Fettuccine Alfredo
description: A simple yet elegant dish of fettuccine pasta tossed in a rich, creamy Parmesan cheese sauce.
steps: Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Drain, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and stir in Parmesan cheese until melted and the sauce is smooth.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet and toss to coat. Add reserved pasta water as needed to reach desired consistency.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately.

name: Classic Bruschetta
description: A classic Italian appetizer of grilled bread rubbed with garlic and topped with tomatoes, fresh basil, and olive oil.
steps: Preheat grill or broiler. Toast bread slices until golden brown on both sides.
In a bowl, combine diced tomatoes, basil, olive oil, and minced garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
Rub one side of each toasted bread slice with a whole garlic clove (optional, for extra flavor).
Top each slice of bread with the tomato mixture.
Serve immediately.

name: Veal Marsala
description: Tender veal cutlets in a rich and savory mushroom and Marsala wine sauce.
steps: Dredge veal cutlets in flour seasoned with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and 1 tbsp of butter. Cook the veal in batches until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the remaining butter and sauté the mushrooms until browned.
Pour in the Marsala wine to deglaze the pan, scraping up any browned bits. Cook until the wine reduces by half.
Stir in the chicken broth and simmer until the sauce thickens slightly.
Return the veal to the pan and simmer for a few minutes to heat through. Serve immediately.

name: 2-Minute Instant Noodles
description: The quintessential quick meal. Ready in a flash and surprisingly satisfying.
steps: Boil water in a small pot.
Add the noodles and the seasoning packet.
Cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Optional: Crack an egg into the pot during the last minute of cooking.
Pour into a bowl and enjoy immediately.

name: Scrambled Eggs on Toast
description: A classic, protein-packed breakfast or quick snack that's hard to get wrong.
steps: Whisk eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Pour in the egg mixture. Cook, stirring gently, until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
While eggs are cooking, toast the bread slices.
Serve the scrambled eggs on top of the toast.

name: Simple Chicken Sandwich
description: A no-fuss, satisfying sandwich using pre-cooked chicken. Perfect for a quick lunch.
steps: In a small bowl, mix the shredded chicken with mayonnaise, salt, and pepper.
Spread the chicken mixture on one slice of bread.
Top with the lettuce leaf and the other slice of bread.
Cut in half and serve.

name: One-Pan Lemon Herb Chicken
description: A full meal with minimal cleanup. Tender chicken and roasted vegetables all cooked on a single sheet pan.
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss potatoes with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet. Roast for 15 minutes.
Push potatoes to one side. Add chicken and asparagus. Drizzle with remaining olive oil, oregano, and juice from half the lemon.
Roast for another 15-20 minutes, until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with remaining lemon wedges.

name: Speedy Beef & Broccoli Stir-fry
description: Faster than takeout! A classic beef and broccoli stir-fry that's ready in under 20 minutes.
ingredients: 1 head of broccoli, cut into florets
steps: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce and cornstarch. Add beef and toss to coat.
Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add beef and cook until browned. Remove from skillet.
Add broccoli to the skillet with a splash of water, cover and steam for 2-3 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return beef to the skillet. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Serve immediately over cooked rice.
